page.title: 18HARVEL AT WORK
page.content: In the Harvel area there are no large employers. There is a small light engineering works in the centre of the village producing parts for the gas container industry. Farms now need less workers due to mechanisation and modern methods of farming. Due to the increased amount of leisure time, several livery and riding stables have been established, and recently a stud farm. Dog breeding is done on a small scale, and boarding kennels are also provided. Greyhounds are trained to a high standard on two tracks. In such a rural area, a number of local people sell eggs, goat's milk, fruit and vegetables from the farm gate. The majority of workers leave on a daily basis to employment in the surrounding areas of the Medway Towns, Gravesend or London, commuting by car, train or coach.
